urls.title: 3G Pitches: Is the UK sleepwalking into a public health crisis? - Fully Charged Show
urls.description: Almost three years ago I was enjoying my retirement, making lots of happy memories with my grandchildren. Then I found out that our council wanted to build a 3G rubber crumb football pitch right next door to their primary school. This triggered something that I’ d read earlier about a young goalkeeper getting cancer after playing on these pitches. I had to find out more. This was of concern to me personally as my family and friends enjoy playing and coaching football, as well a s for the 630 pupils who

People’s relationship with water is threatened by the changes we see today, be it floods, drought or poor water quality from pollution, says @EmmaHowardBoyd of @EnvAgency.

‘These changes are linked so our response should be joined up too.’

#UKClimateAdapt

The @EnvAgency’s @EmmaHowardBoyd calls on individuals, communities, charities, businesses, farmers, land managers and infrastructure providers to build resilience of millions more homes and businesses.

‘We will work with anyone and everyone – even the beavers.”

#UKClimateAdapt

"The @EnvAgency is close to completing our current six year £2.6bn building programme which will better protect another 300,000 homes and businesses by April 2021. And we are preparing to launch the next six year investment programme with double the amount of money" https://t.co/auKKiTEmkK
